Package game.board

Class Board

java.lang.Object
game.board.Board
public class Board extends Object
The `Board` class represents a chess board and provides methods for making moves, managing game state, and interacting with bitboards. In a sense it functions similiar to the classical controller.

The board is represented as an 8x8 array of squares, and each square may contain a chess piece. Various methods are provided for adding, moving, and removing pieces, as well as for generating valid moves and managing game state.

Whenever a change is made on the board this class further ensures that the BitBoards inside the BitBoard class are also updated.

Position paramaters like to and from are always given in BitBoard annotation.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ryu

  • Method Details

    • addPiece

      public void addPiece(int pos, int pieceType, int pieceColour)
      Adds a piece to the chess board at the specified position. Also syncs the piece to the bitboards.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position on the board where the piece will be added (0-63).
      pieceType - The type of the piece to be added.
      pieceColour - The color of the piece to be added (0 for white, 1 for black). Add to Square centric Board and to bitboards.

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece(int from, int to)
      Moves a piece from one position to another on the chess board. Coordinates manipulation of gameState, BitBoards, and Board.
      Parameters:
      from - The current position of the piece (0-63).
      to - The target position for the piece (0-63).

    • showValidMoves

      public long showValidMoves(int from)
      Displays the valid moves for a piece at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      from - The position of the piece for which valid moves are to be displayed.
      Returns:
      A long value representing the valid moves as a bitboard.

    • loadFENBoard

      public void loadFENBoard(String fen)
      Loads a chess board position from a Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) string.
      Parameters:
      fen - The FEN string representing the board position.

    • loadPreviousBoard

      public void loadPreviousBoard()
      Loads the previous chess board position from the game state stack.

    • toBBSquare

      public static int toBBSquare(int pos)
      Inverts the position info. A standard 2D Array is nubered 0-63 but from top to botom unlike the BitBoard which is numbered bottom to top.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position on the chess board (0 to 63).
      Returns:
      The corresponding index in the bitboard.

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame()
      Saves the current game state to a file named "SavedGame.txt" in the project directory. The method writes the FEN string of the current game state to the file. Displays a success message if the save is successful, otherwise prints an error message.

    • translateBBToSquare

      public static String translateBBToSquare(int bb)
      Translates a bitboard index to a chess board square representation.
      Parameters:
      bb - The bitboard index.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the corresponding chess board square.

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard(PieceI[] square)

    • printBitBoard

      public static void printBitBoard(long bits, boolean enableIndex)

    • printAllBB

      public static void printAllBB(boolean enableIndex)
